data.title: Renaming grandparent folders of edited files does not work (Atom Beta)
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

You cannot rename folders in Atom BETA on at least Windows 10 and Windows 7 when a file in a sub-folder of the targeted folder to be renamed is edited. This also affects windows explorer. It gives an error that the folder cannot be renamed because it is in use by another program.

Steps to reproduce found here: https://github.com/johnpyp/atom-canary-isolation

**Expected behavior:** Folder renames normally even if file is changed

**Actual behavior:** Folder (in Atom) does not have permission to change and (in explorer) doesn't get renamed due to "the folder being open in another program".

**Reproduces how often:** 100% (3 tests so far, fairly thorough in terms of testing order of things and different operations to try to affect it. Two different folder and file structures analyzed to reproduce)

### Versions
Atom    : 1.21.0-beta2
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
apm  1.18.5
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python
git 2.14.1.windows.1
visual studio

Tested on Windows 10 and Windows 7,  not sure what versions.
You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

**Edit:** Seems to be a long-standing bug in normal Atom too, just happens to be a case I have only really run in with using the Beta (though I do remember this error popping up in normal Atom).

data.title: Unsigned Application Warning
data.body:
When I downloaded the 1.20.1 version of Atom and attempted to install it over an existing install I got a warning from OSX saying that the application was unsigned. This is different from the "you downloaded this off the internet" warning- the actual code signing certificate itself was not trusted.

Downloading the app a second time got the appropriate installer which was properly signed.

Unfortunately I did not keep a copy of the original "unsigned" application for analysis (and yes, I'm regretting that), but I think you should spot check your download servers to make sure they are all pushing out the right application (and that a development version, or worse yet a malicious binary, were not being served).

data.body:

### Description

Heredoc messes syntax and diagnostics gives errors

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Write heredoc PHP syntax

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
Everytime
### Versions
Atom    : 1.21.0-beta1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87

### Additional Information

When it's near the gutter it works as expected and syntax is right
![Works correctly](https://i.imgur.com/Sa5HD9J.png)

data.title: Restore a missing "typeof"
data.body:
The deactivationResult returned from a package's `deactivate()` method was having its `then` property compared to the string `"function"` rather than its _type_ being compared to `"function"`. As a result, async package deactivation functions were not returning the correct Promise from `PackageManager.deactivatePackage()`.

Quick fix :zap:

data.title: [Python] Line, which starts from "elif" or "else" moves one indent level left
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When line starts from "elif" or "else" keyword, has some indentation (I use tabs) and you add something to it, then it automatically moves to one indent level left.

### Steps to Reproduce

0. Maybe to check preferences to be consistent with myne. Also to use tab key (and tabs) for indentation.
1. Make some block with indentation
2. Add line with "if" on it; and it's block
3. Add line with "elif" or "else" and something into it. 
4. After you'll press ":", than this line will be moved to one indentation level left.
5. After this if you'll move this line to one indentation right - it'll be moved
6. If you'll try to change something on this line - it'll be moved to one indentation level left again.

**Expected behavior:** Nothing would be moved to one indentation level left
**Actual behavior:** Line is moved to one indentation level left

**Reproduces how often:** Always (or often)

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.14rc1
git 2.14.1

OS: Debian Sid x64
Linux: 4.12.0-1-amd64

**Atom's preferences**:
____Editor tab:
________Auto Indent: True
________Auto Indent On Paste: True
________Soft Tabs: False
________Tab Type: Auto

### Additional Information

**Video** with reproduction of this bug on YouTube: https://youtu.be/I-b7O0y13Js
In 1.20.1 this error is present too.

data.title: Dock Handle for Git Tab (right hand dock) not available
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Windows 10 Pro 64ibt
Atom 1.20.1 x64
Dell 4K monitors

I don’t know the name of the UI element that shows up when you hover over the Tree View and Git Tab. It’s a half circle with > or < that allows one to toggle these panes. Dock Handle?

InTree View this UI element shows up when you have the pane open or close by hovering the pane when open and close to the edge of the window when closed. It’s working correctly when the Atom interface is anything else except Maximized

On the Git Tab it does not show up when the tab is closed and one hovers close to the edge or on the edge AND the app window is maximized. It worked as expected when this feature first came available but the last 4, or so, updates it has not worked correctly. If I don’t have the editor sized maximized I can use it by hovering over the right edge of the editor. The half circle slides into view.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom > Window Maximized >Toggle Git Tab 

**Expected behavior:** I expect the tab handle to appear on mouseover

**Actual behavior:** Tab handle does not show up

**Reproduces how often:**  100% of the time

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.
![git-tab](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/759023/30777443-dfffe3e0-a077-11e7-8532-e05549bc90e8.png)

data.title: Only the last snippet listed works, the ones prior to it do not
data.body:
Hello, I can only utilize the last snippet listed in my `snippets.cson` file.
A snippet as simple as:

```
'.text.plain':
  'foo':
    'prefix': 'foo'
    'body': 'foo foo foo'

'.text.plain':
  'bar':
    'prefix': 'bar'
    'body': 'bar bar bar'
```

Typing `foo` = no results
Typing `bar` = `bar bar bar`

---------------------------------------------


Now if I were to reverse the snippet order like so...

```
'.text.plain':
  'bar':
    'prefix': 'bar'
    'body': 'bar bar bar'

'.text.plain':
  'foo':
    'prefix': 'foo'
    'body': 'foo foo foo'
```
Typing `bar` = no results
Typing `foo` = `foo foo foo`

---------------------------------------------

Please note the following:

This still occurs in `atom --safe` mode
This occurs on two totally different systems:
```
Windows 10 64 - (using 32 bit version because 64 bit version fails to install)

Atom    : 1.13.1
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.14.1
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python
git 2.8.3.windows.1
visual studio 2010
```
---------------------------------------------
```
Windows 7 64 - Atom version 1.20.1 x64

Atom    : 1.20.1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python
git
visual studio
```

Please advise on how to resolve this.
Any help will greatly be appreciated.
